p: Amongst the reviewed papers, one relative to Italian EOs [ 39] found that the major compounds were terpinolene (28.5%), piperitone (24.2%), limonene (15.6%), ( E)-β-ocimene (4.7%), β-caryophyllene (2.0%), indole (1.4%), sabinene (1.1%), ( Z)-β-ocimene (1.1%), and myrcene (1.0%); one relative to Chinese EOs from dried leaves [ 61] found terpinolene (37.9%), 2-isopropyl-5-methyl-3-cyclohexen-1-one (14.1%), limonene (13.1%), ( Z)-β-ocimene (8.8%), β-caryophyllene (4.2%), ( E)-β-ocimene (3.0%), p-mentha-1,3,8-triene (1.5%), γ-elemene (1.7%), and p-vinylanisole (1.1%) as the main components.
